metadata.titel_preek: The Messiah Comes to His Temple

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God (as Messiah) enters the temple of human religion to judge corruption and establish pure worship through his own body.

subject.identificatie: Jesus Christ (The Messiah/Messenger of the Covenant)
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus announced in an unmistakable way that he was Lord of the temple
The Son of God has come down out of his place... to take our corrupted nature upon himself

object.identificatie: Pure worship / The restoration of the relationship between God and Man
tekstueel_bewijs: that they may offer unto the LORD an offering in righteousness
Jesus himself becomes the pure worship of the Father

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Prophetic Decree
tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord whom you seek will suddenly come to his temple
that the whole world might be raised to new life
offering of his body and blood for our true worship

helper.identificatie: The Holy Scriptures / The Prophets (Malachi, Micah, Isaiah)
tekstueel_bewijs: The Hebrew Scriptures were the only Bible that Jesus and his disciples knew
they believed the scripture and the word which Jesus had spoken
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit; the Spirit preserves the prophetic word through 'faithful souls'.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin (as a cosmic power) and Religious Idolatry
tekstueel_bewijs: we are programmed by Sin to dig in our heels
our pretensions, our props, our defenses, our masks, and, especially, our idols
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a 'programming' that prevents repentance and requires a 'refiner's fire' to break.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response of faith and admission of judgment.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Christian Community / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The hearer's response (believing) is a direct consequence of Christ's performance (the resurrection).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → Pure Worship → The Church
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Prophetic Word → Jesus Christ ← Sin/Religious Corruption

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord whom you seek shall suddenly come to his temple
The Son of God has come down out of his place
He has come to his temple
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we push these prophecies back into the past

voorbeelden: we must continually hold in our minds
The first thing Christians do is to step forward to admit that we are all under this judgment
we don't want anybody... messing around with it
in his blazing light we see ourselves as the guilty creatures that we are
No one is able to explain why this person has not been arrested
Jesus himself becomes the pure worship
he will not let us go until we are as righteous and holy as he is

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes Christ's sovereign power (Pouvoir) to judge and save, contrasting it with human inability (impotence) to keep Lent or purify themselves.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From False Security (~S2) to Polluted Religion (~S1), through the Refiner's Fire (S2), arriving at Pure Worship (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ occupies S2 (Judgment) on behalf of the hearer to grant S1 (Grace/Pure Worship).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the 'refiner's fire' and 'heap of ruins' are presented as inescapable realities.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon contains strong calls to repentance, the 'engine' is entirely Christocentric. Christ is the Subject of the purification, and the hearer is the object of his refining work.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The first thing Christians do is to step forward to admit that we are all under this judgment.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The refiner's fire is the one he passes through himself.
I have flunked Lent. I flunk it every year.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Levites, Temple authorities) are used as negative mirrors for the hearer, but the resolution is not 'be better' but 'Christ has done it'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Christ is the true Levite who offers the pure sacrifice.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief through the collapse of self-justification.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification by grace through faith, where even the 'offering' is Christ's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from Malachi's judgment to John's Gospel is perfectly integrated through the actant of the 'Temple'.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'Messiah with the whip' and the 'Lamb of God' is the central homiletical pivot.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus goes to lay down his own life... as the true pure worship of the Father.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the Christological endowment of righteousness rather than the Pneumatological.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total; sin is an 'idolatry' and 'programming' that requires the destruction of the old self.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the primary Subject. The narrative moves from the Law's demand for pure worship to Christ's fulfillment of that demand.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly low on the 'how' of the Christian life (Savoir-faire) following the grace event.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase the 'Vouloir' (motivation) as a response to the 'Pouvoir' (Christ's power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Briefly expand on how the 'liberating news' specifically empowers the neighbor-love mentioned in the prophets.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Idolatry) is already sufficiently heavy.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's sacrifice) correctly precedes and enables the Secondary Program (our confession).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in avoiding moralism while maintaining the bite of the Law. By making Christ the Subject of both the judgment and the fulfillment, the preacher ensures the sermon is truly 'Good News'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Handel's Messiah' imagery; Greimas shows that the music serves to mask the 'Opponent' (the pain of the fire).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Malachi's context; Greimas reveals that the 'Temple' functions as a shifting Object of value from a building to a Body.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes the 'Subject-Switch' in the final third of the sermon, where the 'Refiner' (Subject) becomes the 'Refined' (Object/Victim) to save the Receiver.

volledige_subject_lijst: The Son of God (Subject) has come down (Verb)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Refiner's Fire' as a modal bridge between Devoir (what must happen) and Pouvoir (what Christ does).
